331227460433764352.text: "...to enshrine this most righteous of human beings in our national family forever." - PM (2/2)

331226768612655104.text: "I conclude by expressing my gratitude to the Governor-General for this magnificent act of state ..." - PM (1/2)

331226160363102209.text: "Raoul Wallenberg's fate may never be known for sure. He has no grave. But his legacy endures." - PM

331225764991225856.text: "... it is imperative ... to keep alive the memory and example of individuals like Raoul Wallenberg." - PM (2/2)

331225279219507201.text: "As the last witnesses to the horrors of World War II leave us, it is vital ..." - PM (1/2)

331224971445690368.text: "Something that will keep teaching us lessons for as long as humans record their history." - PM

331223780531769346.text: "We are here today to celebrate something exceptional in the human spirit." - PM

331223293971542018.text: "an expression of our deep gratitude for all that our nation gained when so many saved by Wallenberg come to these shores." - PM

164548822326984704.text: PM: "This Labor Government will make the right choices. We will build a new Australian economy. We will get working people a fair share."

164547887886376960.text: PM: "We can choose to face up to the hard decisions now – or take the easy way out today and leave all the hard decisions to our children."

164547258166161408.text: PM: "We can choose to get ready for the future – or stand still."

164546403148906498.text: We can choose to give working people a fair share of the resources boom & today’s economic strength or allow only some to feel the benefits.

164545356665860096.text: PM: "This new economy will be more adaptive, flexible and able to seize new opportunities than ever before."

164542889878241280.text: PM: “In this decade, Australia can build a rich, fair economy – where working people get their share of the benefits.”

164542568267390976.text: PM: "The challenge is to include all our people in the opportunities change creates."

164542069040349184.text: PM: "While economic transformations are never easy, this time we have an advantage we have rarely had before."

164541323825774592.text: PM: "It’s an adjustment, it takes work, it builds strength, it’s an adjustment up, not an adjustment down and we can make it work for us."

164540364424884225.text: PM: "There is a flipside to this story.  We know that some sectors are doing it tough."

164540032974192640.text: PM: "We are one of the economies best placed to capitalise on the global economy’s shifting weight to our region."

164539057261645824.text: PM: "When the global financial crisis hit we funded the best designed stimulus package in the world."

164538628108845057.text: PM: "That’s why Aust has been at the international table in 2011 & we’ll be back there in 2012, arguing for sustainable long-term finances."

164538355328106497.text: PM: "for once, the economists almost all agree – Europe still faces very serious economic difficulties."

164537591578894336.text: PM: “From a strong base, we can build a new economy, one which is even stronger, one which is full of opportunity.”

164527488523976704.text: The PM is outlining her plan for our economy in 2012 in a keynote speech at 1:00PM. Stay tuned, we’ll be live-tweeting snippets. TeamJG

138431949298610176.text: PM: "We will defend our national interests. We will deny terrorism a safe haven in Afghanistan. We will complete our mission."

138430767607984128.text: PM: "We know the good things we have done have come at a high cost. There have been days of sorrow and we do not forget."

138428141273223168.text: PM: "Over the next three years, Australia will complete our mission of training and transition. Australia will not abandon Afghanistan."

138425539311579136.text: PM: "It is time for Pakistan to do more to counter terrorism and extremism."

138425113744908288.text: PM: "Pakistan, its military and people, are on the frontline of terrorism and have been victims of its violence themselves."

138424541792833536.text: PM: "In Uruzgan Australians also work with the Afghan police to get them ready for transition."

138423960298721281.text: PM: "Another example of our work in building Afghan security capacity is our work at the Afghan National Army Artillery Training School."

138423424618995712.text: PM: "Working alongside the Afghan National Interdiction Unit, our Special Forces disrupt the narcotics trade."

138422337346338818.text: PM: "Australia’s national interests in Afghanistan are unchanged - There must be no safe haven for terrorists in Afghanistan."
